candidates.title: Set MSRV to 1.59 and update dependencies
candidates.body:
Several dependencies remain un-upgraded:
- `rpassword` and `clap` are left as-is because our MSRV of 1.59 means using a `cargo` version that cannot handle the new weak or namespaced dependency features correctly (https://github.com/rust-lang/cargo/issues/10623).
- `criterion` is left as-is because the benchmarks use `criterion-cycles-per-byte`.

candidates.title: Update dependencies for rage 0.9.0
candidates.body: This upgrades all dependencies to their latest versions, other than those that drop 1.56.0 compatibility (which we are retaining for 0.9.0).

candidates.title: Add test files from the reference impl, and fix spec divergence

labels.name: spec divergence
labels.description: A divergence between the age specification and this implementation that needs to be resolved

candidates.body: This imports the testkit test files from https://github.com/FiloSottile/age that check for compliance with the now-published https://c2sp.org/age, and fixes `age::x25519` to ensure they pass.

candidates.title: rage-mount: update dependencies fuse_mt, time and zip
candidates.body:
I picked the first commit of `fuse_mt` that switched from using `fuse` to `fuser` (`fuse_mt` hasn't had any new releases since 0.5.1). That way `rage-mount` can be built against libfuse3. `time` and `zip` dependencies update is a side effect due to TimeSpec being obsolete.

WARNING: I've never written any Rust code before, so please bear with my ignorance in the PR.

candidates.title: Fix test and bench support for ARM CPUs
candidates.body:
`cargo test` currently fails on Apple M1 processors with this error:

```
   Compiling i18n-embed v0.13.4
   Compiling i18n-embed-fl v0.6.4
   Compiling criterion-cycles-per-byte v0.1.2
error: criterion-cycles-per-byte currently relies on x86 or x86_64.
  --> /Users/macil/.cargo/registry/src/github.com-1ecc6299db9ec823/criterion-cycles-per-byte-0.1.2/src/lib.rs:34:1
   |
34 | compile_error!("criterion-cycles-per-byte currently relies on x86 or x86_64.");
   | ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^

error[E0308]: mismatched types
  --> /Users/macil/.cargo/registry/src/github.com-1ecc6299db9ec823/criterion-cycles-per-byte-0.1.2/src/lib.rs:41:15
   |
41 | fn rdtsc() -> u64 {
   |    -----      ^^^ expected `u64`, found `()`
   |    |
   |    implicitly returns `()` as its body has no tail or `return` expression

For more information about this error, try `rustc --explain E0308`.
error: could not compile `criterion-cycles-per-byte` due to 2 previous errors
warning: build failed, waiting for other jobs to finish...
error: build failed
```

This PR disables the criterion-cycles-per-byte dev dependency when not on x86 or x86_64. `cargo test` and `cargo bench` work on Apple M1 now.

candidates.title: Build musl Debian packages in addition to glibc
candidates.body: Closes str4d/rage#252.

candidates.title: Implement `confirm` plugin command
candidates.body: Closes str4d/rage#302.

candidates.title: Migrate to rsa 0.6 and chacha20poly1305 0.10
candidates.body:
This brings us onto Rust Crypto crates with MSRV 1.56 or lower.

Closes #304.

candidates.title: Defer writing to stdout if we are reading from TTY
candidates.body: Closes str4d/rage#171.

candidates.title: Migrate to MSRV 1.56.0 and bump dependencies
candidates.body: Closes #285.

candidates.title: Add helper environment variable for debugging plugins
candidates.body:
Setting the `AGEDEBUG` environment variable to `plugin` will cause all
plugin communications, as well as the plugin's stderr, to be printed to
the stderr of the parent process (e.g. rage).

candidates.title: Migrate to hkdf 0.12
candidates.body: We need to depend on two versions of the `sha2` crate because `rsa` doesn't have a version depending on `digest 0.10` yet.

candidates.title: Fix panic in `AgeStanza::body`
candidates.body:
In 0.7.0, Base64 decoding was moved to the `AgeStanza::body` method, with the stanza parser only checking for valid Base64 characters. This caused the parser to start accepting stanzas with non-canonical last body lines (where the Base64 encoding would have trailing bits that could not be decoded into full bytes); calling `AgeStanza::body` on these stanzas would cause a panic.

We fix the parser to reject non-canonical last body lines, turning the panic back into an error.

candidates.title: CI: Add bitrot check to ensure examples and benchmarks still compile
`chacha20poly1305 0.9`
candidates.body: Closes #231.

candidates.title: More dependency updates
candidates.body: MSRV is now 1.51.0.

candidates.title: Dependency updates for 0.6.0
candidates.body:
Excludes:
- `aes 0.7` (requires MSRV bump to 1.49, and `aes-ctr` has not upgraded its trait dependency yet).
- `chacha20poly1305 0.8` (`c2-chacha` has not upgraded its trait dependency yet).
- `rand 0.8` (we depend on crates that require `0.7`).

candidates.title: age: Enable all features and doc_cfg for docs.rs
candidates.body:
This instructs docs.rs to render the feature-flagged parts of the library
in the documentation.

Fixes str4d/rage#209.

candidates.title: Release 0.5.1
candidates.body: Backports #187 onto v0.5.0 to address current `cargo install` breakage.

candidates.title: age-core: Start plugin binaries in a temporary working directory
candidates.body:
We don't want plugin binaries to make any assumptions about where they are run from. The easiest way to ensure this is to always run them from a fresh temporary directory.

Closes str4d/rage#200.

candidates.title: age: Ensure that the fallback language is always loaded
candidates.body: Fixes str4d/rage#159.

candidates.title: age: Add support for using web performance timer to calculate scrypt work factor
candidates.body: Fixes #191

candidates.title: i18n-embed-fl 0.3
candidates.body: Fixes an issue where `cargo update` breaks builds (due to how `i18n-embed-fl 0.2` was not pinning its pre-release `dashmap` dependency).

candidates.title: Fix a bunch of clippy lints

repo.name: rage
repo.description: A simple, secure and modern encryption tool (and Rust library) with small explicit keys, no config options, and UNIX-style composability.

repo.name: rage
repo.description: A simple, secure and modern file encryption tool (and Rust library) with small explicit keys, no config options, and UNIX-style composability.
